title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't default to current type in editor for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, if a .java file is open in the editor and you click the new class button, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank. It should default to the current type in the editor.
OB: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, with a .java file open in the editor, if you click the new class button and check the 'Enclosing Type' field, it is blank.
EB: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, with a .java file open in the editor, if you click the new class button and check the 'Enclosing Type' field, it should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
1. Open Build 20011106.
2. Open a .java file in the editor.
3. Click the new class button.
4. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field.
5. Observe that it is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
